paper_abstract: The harmonic index H(G) of a graph G is the sum of 2/ d(u)+d(v)over all edges uv of G, where d(u) denotes the degree of a vertex u in G. In this paper, we give the minimum value of H(G) for graphs G with given minimum degree delta(G) >= 2 and characterize the corresponding extremal graph. Furthermore, we prove a best-possible lower bound on the harmonic index of a triangle-free graph G with arbitrary minimum degree delta(G).
paper_title: On The Harmonic Index and The Minimum Degree of A Graph
